questions.question: An ecommerce company wants to monitor their product recommendation model for potential bias against certain customer segments.  Which statement best describes how Amazon SageMaker Clarify can help with this task?
options: SageMaker Clarify can only detect bias in the training data used to build the recommendation model, but not in the model's predictions.
SageMaker Clarify can monitor the model's predictions for bias or feature attribution drift, helping identify if certain customer segments are being treated unfairly.
SageMaker Clarify can only detect bias in numerical features like purchase history or browsing behavior, but not in categorical features like customer demographics.
SageMaker Clarify can automatically adjust the model's parameters to mitigate any detected bias.
correct_answers: SageMaker Clarify can monitor the model's predictions for bias or feature attribution drift, helping identify if certain customer segments are being treated unfairly.
